snippet: After the Australian native Christopher Lane was gunned down while visiting Duncan, Okla., three young men said they had shot him because they were bored and looking for a thrill.
abstract: Teenagers James Edwards Jr, Chancey Luna and Michael Jones are charged, as adults, with first-degree murder in shooting of Australian native Christopher Lane in Duncan, Okla; suspects said they shot Lane, who was jogging, because they were bored and looking for a thrill; murder is seen as tale of alienated and idle teens from broken and impoverished families, seemingly drawn to small-town version of urban gang culture.

byline.contributor: Sheelagh McNeill contributed research from New York, and Kitty Bennett from Seattle.

lead_paragraph: After the Australian native Christopher Lane was gunned down while visiting Duncan, Okla., three young men said they had shot him because they were bored and looking for a thrill.

headline.main: End of an Aimless Summer: 3 Youths Charged in a Killing
headline.print_headline: End of an Aimless Summer: 3 Youths Charged in a Killing
